meanings.sent1: The squirrel climbed up the bole of the oak tree.
meanings.sent2: The bole of the pine tree was sturdy and tall.
meanings.sent3: The bole of the tree seemed to be the perfect spot for the woodpecker to practice its drumming skills.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows cast by the bole of the tree stretched across the forest floor like long fingers.
meanings.sent5: The rough texture of the bole made it easy for the children to climb and play hide-and-seek.

meanings.definition: A large, thick stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The pumpkin vine's bole twisted and turned as it grew across the garden.
meanings.sent2: The bole of the sunflower was so thick that it needed extra support.
meanings.sent3: The bole of the plant looked like a green snake slithering through the soil.
meanings.sent4: The bole of the bamboo plant stood tall and proud in the garden, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The bole of the rose bush was covered in thorns, making it difficult to prune.

meanings.definition: A type of clay used in pottery.
meanings.sent1: The potter carefully molded the bole into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The bole was mixed with water to create the perfect consistency for the pottery.
meanings.sent3: The bole on the potter's wheel spun gracefully as the artist shaped it into a bowl.
meanings.sent4: The bole transformed under the potter's skilled hands, becoming a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The rich color of the bole added depth and character to the finished pottery piece.
